body:
### Problem

I tried to remove build and .deps directories, but still I get this error.

```
OK        Successfully built LuaJIT
gmake[2]: выход из каталога «/Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/build/src/luajit/src»
==== Successfully built LuaJIT 2.1 ====
==== Installing LuaJIT 2.1.1707061634 to /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr ====
mkdir -p /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/bin /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/lib /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/include/luajit-2.1 /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/share/man/man1 /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/pkgconfig /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/share/luajit-2.1/jit /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/share/lua/5.1 /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/lua/5.1
cd src && install -m 0755 luajit /Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/usr/bin/luajit-2.1.1707061634
/bin/sh: line 0: cd: src: No such file or directory
gmake[1]: *** [Makefile:131: install] Ошибка 1
gmake[1]: выход из каталога «/Users/m.doronin/code/neovim/.deps/build/src/luajit»
[117/136] Performing build step for 'treesitter'
[1/2] Building C object CMakeFiles/tree-sitter.dir/lib/src/lib.c.o
[2/2] Linking C static library libtree-sitter.a
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
make: *** [Makefile:88: deps] Error 1
```

### Steps to reproduce

`make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo`

### Expected behavior

Build is successful.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

commit 422b090

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

—

### Operating system/version

macOS 14.2

### Terminal name/version

—

### $TERM environment variable

—

### Installation

build from repo

comment_data.body: Works fine here. Can you give more information about your environment (shell -- exact version, homebrew installs, ENV variables, ...)?
Can you `git clean -fdx && git restore .`, then `make` and upload the full log (as a file, don't paste) here? (Preferably in English, sorry.)

> Works fine here. Can you give more information about your environment (shell -- exact version, homebrew installs, ENV variables, ...)?

Here’s the list of installed ports.
[out.txt](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/14308686/out.txt)
T-that's a lot. Sorry, I can't help further with this.

Can you please try the verbose mode for building `.deps`:

```bash
make clean distclean         # rm -rf .deps build/ if needed
cmake -S cmake.deps -B .deps -G 'Ninja'
ninja -C .deps --verbose
```

it will probably fail on building `.deps`; look at the relevant logs in the last few lines about libtree-sitter.

Also suggest upgrading make and cmake -- the version seems a bit old.

Can you try running

```
cmake -S cmake.deps -B .deps -G Ninja -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
cmake --build .deps
cmake -B build -G Ninja -D CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo
cmake --build build
```

and see if this works? I suspect this might be same problem as https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/27475
@purpleP did it used to work before? If so, could you bisect when it started failing?

> @purpleP did it used to work before? If so, could you bisect when it started failing?

It used to work, but I've tried to find some working commit and couldn’t find any even thousand commits earlier. So I think it’s some kind of combination of my environment and instability of neovim’s build.

> Can you please try the verbose mode for building `.deps`:
> 
> ```shell
> make clean distclean         # rm -rf .deps build/ if needed
> cmake -S cmake.deps -B .deps -G 'Ninja'
> ninja -C .deps --verbose
> ```
> 
> it will probably fail on building `.deps`; look at the relevant logs in the last few lines about libtree-sitter.
> 
> Also suggest upgrading make and cmake -- the version seems a bit old.

[out 2.txt](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/files/14492557/out.2.txt)
Looking at the logs it looks like you're failing to build luajit. Can you try building only luajit and see if it works? Link: https://github.com/LuaJIT/LuaJIT
This has been closed since a request for information has not been answered for 30 days. It can be reopened when the requested information is provided.

comment_data.body:
> Looking at the logs it looks like you're failing to build luajit. Can you try building only luajit and see if it works? Link: https://github.com/LuaJIT/LuaJIT

Yes, it builds successfully.

labels.description: We need minimal steps to reproduce the issue
labels.name: needs:repro

title: Build fails on macOS
